oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sardis Baptist Church: history and property description
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: History of Sardis Baptist Church, its historical significance and property description.

The congregation of Sardis Baptist Church dates to 1884. The church served a stable working-class community on Enon Ridge. The Alabama Christian Movement for Human Rights (ACMHR) was created there and expanded the Civil Rights Movement across the state. Civil rights rallies and meetings took place there during the 1950s and 1960s.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Alabama Christian Movement for Human Rights; African American Churches -- Tennessee; Civil Rights -- United States
